Package main.java

Class LoggedIn

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.LoggedIn
  • class LoggedIn
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents a customer LoggedIn.
    Author:
    Eduardo Nunes

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Products availableProducts
      All products in the database
      private Promotions availablePromotions
      All customers in the database
      private Customers cs
      All orders in the database
      private Customer customer
      The customer that is logged in
      private Date loggedDate
      The date the customer logged in

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      LoggedIn​(Customer loggedC, Date logged, Products ap, java.util.Scanner sc, Promotions apromo, Customers availableCustomers)
      Constructor for the LoggedIn class that assigns the object Customer to the one that logged in, along with the current Date, available Products, all Customers and Promotions and prints the LoggedIn menu.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LoggedIn

        public LoggedIn​(Customer loggedC,
                Date logged,
                Products ap,
                java.util.Scanner sc,
                Promotions apromo,
                Customers availableCustomers)
        Constructor for the LoggedIn class that assigns the object Customer to the one that logged in, along with the current Date, available Products, all Customers and Promotions and prints the LoggedIn menu.
        Parameters:
        loggedC - the customer that is logged in to apply transport fees associated with the type of customer
        logged - Date the date that the customer logged in to check what promotions are available at that time
        ap - Products object to access the products that the store has to offer
        sc - Scanner object to read inputs
        apromo - Promotions object to search for promotions and apply them
        availableCustomers - All customers object to update the customers file object

    • Method Detail

      • menu

        private void menu​(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Method that prints out the LoggedIn menu

        In this method the user is asked:

        • If he wants to make an order - menu(Scanner)
        • If he wants to check is previous orders - viewOrders()
        • If he wants to Log out (exit to the previous menu)
        Parameters:
        sc - Scanner object to read inputs

      • makeOrder

        private Order makeOrder​(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Method that allows logged in customers to make an order.
        Parameters:
        sc - Scanner object to read inputs
        Returns:
        Order object with the order made

      • viewOrders

        private void viewOrders()
        Method that prints out the customer's previous orders, this method checks if the customer has any previous orders. If he does, it prints out the orders.

        On a important Note:

        There's no need to load the customers from the .obj file because if the customer made orders after the Customers is constructed, they are already in the customer Customer.orders object.
